name: List
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry
List
description: Entry::List is a special case Array with additional values.

methods.name: token
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry
List#token
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: token=
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry
List#token=
methods.description: If not empty, indicates that there are more records that match the request and this value should be passed to continue.

methods.name: next?
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry
List#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of entries.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

entries = logging.entries
if entries.next?
  next_entries = entries.next
end

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging

entries = dataset.entries
if entries.next?
  next_entries = entries.next
end

methods.name: all
title: Gcloud
Logging
Entry
List#all
methods.description:
Retrieves all log entries by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each log entry, which is passed as the parameter.

An Enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all log entries are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each log entry by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
entries = logging.entries order: "timestamp desc"

entries.all do |entry|
  puts "[#{e.timestamp}] #{e.log_name} #{e.payload.inspect}"
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
entries = logging.entries order: "timestamp desc"

all_payloads = entries.all.map do |entry|
  entry.payload
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
entries = logging.entries order: "timestamp desc"

entries.all(request_limit: 10) do |entry|
  puts "[#{e.timestamp}] #{e.log_name} #{e.payload.inspect}"
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to make
to load all log entries. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each log entry.
